result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott M. Engel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a High School Diploma, GED or HSED.

Defendant is to have no contact whatsoever with M. Engel and/or S. Engel as named in the Complaint or their residence, unless contact is specifically requested in writing by the victims directly to the Supervising Agent.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is to have no unexcused absences or unexcused tardiness from school.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.

Defendant to complete an Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as coordinated through the supervising agent.  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Scott M. Engel
Current: N6952 N County Rd A, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 01-12-2016)
Prior: 228 Century Drive, Apt 104, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States
JOC returned by USPS - Not Deliverable as addressed - Unable to Forward

Case Called @ 11:24 AM: Defendant Scott M. Engel in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Victim present in courtroom.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  ADA states any uncharged read ins for any potential BJump charges as to nonattendance to school as required by bond will no longer be charged.  Def understands exclusive nature of potential uncharged offenses.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  Statement by SPD as to no contact provisions being requested by victim.  Statement by ADA as to concerns brought forth this morning by victim.  The Court:  Addresses Def as to his conduct and his responsibility to abide by rules imposed.  75 days WCJ (1 day TS credit) - I/S - S/W - 18 mos probation.  Conditions:  Obtain HSED, GED or high school diploma; may petition the court at any time after 1 yr if supported by your agent and diploma obtained; complete AODA and any follow thru as recommended; No contact with parents without written permission given by the parents directly to supervising agent; no contact with their residence; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Complete Anger Mgmt corrdinated thru agent; Court Costs; may petition for expungement if successfully discharged if all programing has been completed and joined by agent; DNA sample to be provided today and surcharge assessed.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.   Appeal Rights Given.  SPD questions term of supervision.  Court will impose 1 yr probation rather than 18 mos.  No unexcused absences and no unexcused tardiness from school.
Plea hearing at 11-10-2015 11:00 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court, appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Requests scheduling of Plea Hrg - proposed PPDA.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Case Called @ 1:10 PM: Defendant Scott M. Engel in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def FTA on 9/15/2015.  ADA argues as to bond request - Attendance reports rec'd from Wautoma HS - noting several absences.  State argues for either add'l cash bond or higher level of Signature Bond w/new conditions requested as well.  SPD:  Argues for imposition of a Signature Bond.  Eligibility confirmed.  Requests slight modification as to no contact provisions.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State again affirmed.  Court orders $1000.00 Signature Bond w/conditions.  Def understands and recites all conditions of bond to confirm with the Court.  SPD does confirm eligibility for services thru SPD as of yesterday.  NGP Entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 10:20 am.
In WC Jail
of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

10:21 am case called.  Defendant Scott M. Engel not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by ADA Anderson-no discussions have taken place but defendant is not attending school. Court makes a statement regarding non-appearance and status of counsel. Court authorizes a warrant, State of Wisconsin. Court orders bond be forfeited due to non-appearance.

Case Called @ 2:15 PM: Defendant Scott M. Engel in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Def has not rec'd a copyof the Complaint.  ADA serves another copy of Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - states he will retain his own counsel.  Court will proceed with that understanding that Def will retain his own consel.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 10:10 am.
